message:
In July, Meta banned the use of “Zionist” as a cover for attacks on Jews or Israelis on its platforms.
“Using code words, like ‘Zionist,’ does not eliminate the possibility that your speech violates the NDAH [Nondiscrimination and Anti-Harassment] Policy,” read NYU’s new student community standards, which it published on Thursday.
Pro-Palestinian activists claim that targeting “Zionists” is not antisemitic because not all Jews identify as Zionists.
In addition to advising against targeting “Zionists,” NYU’s revised guidelines spell out that encampments and overnight protests are not permitted on NYU’s campus.
The guidelines do not distinguish between targeting Jews and targeting Zionists, nor do they address the presence of anti-Zionist Jews in many of the campus protests; one such NYU group calls itself Jews Against Zionism.

title: Chicago exorcises ghosts of 1968 - Evanston Now
message:
Besides police behavior (which some 2024 protesters still criticized), a big difference between 1968 and 2024 was the mayor.
Delegate Alejandro Gallegos, from the small town of Crete, wore a kaffiyeh, which has become a symbol of Palestinian rights.
Delegate Alejandro Gallegos at Illinois DNC delegate breakfast.
Chicago police estimates were around 3,500 to 4,000 on Monday, and 3,000 on Thursday, in the two largest demonstrations.
But as Rep. Jan Schakowsky (D-Evanston) said, “all in all, I think this will be viewed as a very successful event here in Chicago.”

title: An Oct . 7 survivor and other Jewish and Israeli athletes to watch at the Paris Paralympics
message:
Here are some of the Jewish and Israeli Paralympians to watch in Paris.
Peter is a member of the U.S. national team that won gold at the 2023 Parapan American Games.
Dadon, 23, also won seven gold medals at World Championships in 2022 and 2023, and nine golds at European Championships between 2018 and 2024.
He won gold medals in the high jump T63 at the 2023 World Championships and the 2019 World Junior Championships.
In addition to his 2020 gold, Seidenfeld also won gold medals at the 2019 and 2023 Parapan American Games.

title: Lawsuit accuses Mort Klein , ZOA head , of sexist , racist behavior
message:
By Arno Rosenfeld November 14, 2022The former deputy to Mort Klein, president of the Zionist Organization of America, is suing him and the group, accusing the often combative leader of racist and sexist behavior.
According to the lawsuit, which was filed earlier this month in New York Supreme Court, Klein has a history of denigrating Black people and women.
“I have my reasons,” Klein allegedly said after Rosen questioned that decision.
Rosen alleged in the lawsuit that Klein mismanaged the ZOA, “created a toxic office environment” and bullied its staff.
“Klein was unwilling to abide by the law to the extent it deemed such law inconvenient,” the lawsuit stated.

title: How has Jordan Bardella voted in the European Parliament ?
message:
Support for UkraineThis was the first resolution passed by the European Parliament in Strasbourg following the European elections in June.
Bardella voted against the text, which called on the European Union to step up its support for Ukraine against Russia's war of aggression.
The resolution was adopted by the European Parliament on 18 January by 312 votes to 131, with 72 abstentions.
The European Parliament adopted this text in February 2021 with 582 votes in favour, 40 against and 69 abstentions.
Like all RN MEPs, Bardella was absent from the vote — a sign of the party's fragmentation on this issue.
